page.title: 06Social Life Coolham/Shipley
page.content: A new stained glass window in Shipley Church by Margaret Traherne marks 50 yrs. of the First Shipley and South- water Scouts. Originally using the Andrew Hall 1934-46, an RAF hut at Smithies Hill '53, the group now has its own H.Q. in Dragons Green. One of the most active troops in the county, its members (18 Scouts, 26 Cubs, 17 Ventures inc. 2 girls, 8 leaders) raise funds for activities by hiring out marquees. The First Coolham Brownie Pack (foun- ded{1985}) & Coolham Playgroup meet at Coolham Village Hall. Other organisations associated with the area include the Shipley Football Club at Dragons Green, the Coolham & Shipley W.I., the long established Coolham Whist Club, the Shipley Gun Club and the Shipley & Coolham Conser- vative Association.
